ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: pre-treatment assessment or post-assessment
answer to screen question 14
Notes: 0 = no; 1 = yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: answer to screen question 15
Notes: 0 = no; 1 = yes; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: there is no evidence that the person has been distracted, disorganized, impulsive, or unable to sit still over the past 6 months
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often fails to give close attention to details or makes careless mistakes in schoolwork, at work, or other activities
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often has difficulty sustaining attention in tasks or play activities
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often does not seem to listen when spoken to directly
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often does not follow through on instructions and fails to finish schoolwork, chores, or duties in the workplace
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often has difficulty organizing tasks and activities
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often avoids, dislikes, or is reluctant to enggage in tasks that require sustained mental effort
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often looses things necessary for tasks or activities
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often easily distracted by extraneous stimuli
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often forgetful in everyday activities
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: at least 5 A.1 sxs are coded "3"
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often fidgits with or taps hands or feet or squirms in seat
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often leaves seat in situations when remaining seated is expected
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often runs about or climbs in situations where it is inappropriate (may be limited to feeling restless in adolescents and adults)
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often unable to play or engage in leisure activities quietly
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often on the go acting as if driven by a motor
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often talks excessively
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often blurts out an answer before a question has been completed
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: often has difficulty waiting his or her turn
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: oftern interrupts or intrudes on others
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: at least five A.2 sxs are coded "3"
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: criterion A.1 or A.2 is coded "3"
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: several inattentive or hyperactive-impulsive symptoms are present before age 12
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: several inattentive or hyperactive-impulsive symptoms are present in two or more settings
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: there is clear evidence that the symptoms interfere with or reduce the quality of social, academic, or occupational functioning
Notes: 1= Absent or False; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold or True; 4= Mild; 5= Moderate; 6= Severe; -7= N/A; -9= Missing or Not Reported

ElementDescription: symptoms do not occur exclusively during the course of schizophrenia or other psychotic disorder and are not better explained by another mental disorder
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2= subthreshold; 3= threshold or true; -7= N/A; -9= missing or not reported

ElementDescription: criteria A,B,C,D, and E are coded "3"
Notes: 1= absent or false; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: type of ADHD presentation
Notes: 1= predominantly inattentive presentation; 2 = predominantly hyperactive-impulsive presentation; 3 = combined presentation; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported

ElementDescription: ADHD; current severity
Notes: 1= mild; 2 = moderate; 3 = severe; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported
